ops.js: { let pos = getEntityPosition({entityId:8}); Bank[6][4] = pos.x; Bank[6][6] = pos.y; Bank[6][8] = pos.z; Bank[6][2] = pos.triangleId; }
{ let pos = getPartyMemberPosition({partyId:0}); Bank[6][4] = pos.x; Bank[6][6] = pos.y; Bank[6][8] = pos.z; Bank[6][2] = pos.triangleId; }
climbLadder({x:-210, y:295, z:381, triangleId:45, advanceKey:Key.Up, animationId:3, facingDirection:128, speed:1});

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:5}); // {Cloud}
“ATB means Active Time Battle. It's a
system in which time
continuously runs during battle.”{PAUSE}“If the ATB is changed to
[WAIT] in the Config Menu…
Time stops during battle
while you select magic or an item.”{PAUSE}“That lets you select your commands carefully.
It's geared especially
for beginners like you.”{PAUSE}“In the Config menu, if you change from ATB
to [Recommended]…Time will stop
while magic or item effects are displayed.”{PAUSE}“This lets you watch the effects carefully.
Letting you fight at your own pace…
this is the way to go.”{PAUSE}“I always use ACTIVE mode,
but choose what you want.
That's all.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:6}); // {Cloud}
“During a battle,
white numbers that appear on the screen
indicate damage,
and green numbers indicate recovery points.”{PAUSE}“Remember that,
if you don't want to be Wiped Out.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:7}); // {Cloud}
“Change will change your fighting position
to either the front or back row.”{PAUSE}“If you select the back row,
the amount of damage
you receive is reduced,
but so is your attacking power.”{PAUSE}“[Change] can be selected from the battle menu
by pushing the [left Directional button].”{PAUSE}“You can also select [Defend] from battle menu
by pushing the Directional button to the right.”{PAUSE}“Defend will reduce your damage by half
until your next turn.”{PAUSE}“It's better to use Defend for strong enemies.
Of course, I don't need anything like that.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:8}); // {Cloud}
“I don't know too much about Escape
during battles since I never do it,
but…someone like you might need it.”{PAUSE}“You can escape by holding down
{PURPLE}[PAGEUP]{WHITE} and {PURPLE}[PAGEDOWN]{WHITE} in battle.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:9}); // {Cloud}
“It might be hard to understand this next one
since you can't check it right now,
but just listen.”{PAUSE}“I'm talking about the Gauges
displayed during battle.”{PAUSE}“The Time Gauge shows the time remaining
until your next turn during battle.”{PAUSE}“You can enter a command
once the Gauge is full,
but if you don't want to enter a command,
press {PURPLE}[MENU]{WHITE}
to skip to the next person.”{PAUSE}“This is good
when you want to
make {Barret} work.”{PAUSE}“The Limit Gauge increases
as you receive damage.
When this is full,
you are able to use a Limit Technique.”{PAUSE}“The Limit Gauge doesn't reset
after each battle,
so it will build up the more damage
you get in battle.”{PAUSE}“The trick is knowing when to use it
instead of using it as soon as
it becomes available.”{PAUSE}“You may already know this,
but I'll tell you anyways.
Status has two conditions:
Fury and Sadness.”{PAUSE}“Fury speeds up your Limit Gauge,
but decreases your concentration.”{PAUSE}“Sadness slows down your Limit Gauge,
but also decreases the damage you receive.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:12}); // {Cloud}
“Status simply means
the status of the characters.”{PAUSE}“I don't want to repeat myself too much,
so I'll mention the main points.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:13}); // Sleep
Cannot enter command until awakened.{PAUSE}Poison
Rapidly decreases HP during battle.{PAUSE}Fury
Doubles damage, reduces concentration.
Tranquilizer cures it.{PAUSE}Sadness
Reduces damage. Hyper cures it.{PAUSE}Petrify
Turns you into stone.
If entire party is petrified,
you'll get Wiped Out.{PAUSE}Confusion
You cannot distinguish
between enemy and ally.{PAUSE}Silence
You cannot cast any Magic.{PAUSE}Paralysis
Time Gauge stops,
you cannot enter commands.{PAUSE}Darkness
Reduces attack concentration.{PAUSE}Frog
Turns you into a frog. I hate this.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:14}); // {Cloud}
“Phew…I'm tired.”{PAUSE}“Changed Status can be changed
with magic and items, so always double
check it when you buy things.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:15}); // {Cloud}
“Elementals are special Materia that
come with magic and weapons.”{PAUSE}“You have to use this
to your advantage in battle.”{PAUSE}“Only once you start thinking
in terms of Elementals can you
truly be called an intermediate player.”{PAUSE}“Here are some examples.
Remember, they're just examples.
You don't have to memorize them.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:16}); // Fire
Fire effect. Works best on animals
and water monsters.{PAUSE}Ice
Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters
and things that hate the cold.{PAUSE}Lightning
Lightning effect.
Works best on mechanical things.{PAUSE}Earth
Attacks using the earth's power.
Doesn't work on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Poison
Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on
any poison-based enemies.{PAUSE}Gravity
Gravity-based attack.
These hurt if they hit.{PAUSE}Water
Calls on the earth's water.
Works well on fire monsters.{PAUSE}Wind
Calls up the winds.
Works well on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Holy
Summons the Planet's power.
Works well on dark monsters.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:17}); // {Cloud}
“Using opposite Elementals often is
effective in battle.”{PAUSE}“Using the same Elementals
usually increases Defense.”{PAUSE}“But, the reverse is also true.
Watch out for it.”{PAUSE}“To find out what Elementals an enemy has,
you need Sense Materia.
Once you get it, try it out.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:10}); // {Cloud}
“If you don't understand what I just told you,
I guess you just have a limited capacity
for information.”{PAUSE}“But, relax.
Push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE} during battle.”{PAUSE}“A Help Message should explain
the different commands to you.”{PAUSE}“It'll tell you things like the monsters' names.
Even I look at it, sometimes…
so don't be ashamed to use it.”

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:18}); // “This is the Beginner's Hall
(Intermediate)!”{PAUSE}“Your explanations were so complicated
I couldn't return to the Planet.”{PAUSE}“So, I have a right to ask you again.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:20}); // {Cloud}
“For my explanation, I'll need a Potion.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:21}); // “Man, ex-SOLDIERs sure are cheap.
OK, I'll GIVE you a Potion…”

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:22}); // “I don't seem to have any on me.
Why don't you go buy one?”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:25}); // “OK wise-guy, I'll ask about Materia
just so you can let off some stress.”

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:27}); // {Cloud}
“First off, the main points.”{PAUSE}“Some types of Materia, like Magic,
grow as you use them.”{PAUSE}“Some, like Summon Magic,
grow from being used
once a battle, to several times per battle.”{PAUSE}“Their effectiveness changes, too.
There are all different kinds.”{PAUSE}“Some types don't change, but
they must grow in order to be divided.”{PAUSE}“…And that's it.
Maybe that sounded too official.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:28}); // {Cloud}
“Types of Materia…
Here goes!”{PAUSE}“{PURPLE}[Independent Materia]{WHITE}
enables Abilities.
No linking required.”{PAUSE}“{CYAN}[Support Materia]{WHITE} is used
with Command, Magic,
and Summon Materia.”{PAUSE}“You must equip them in linked slots or
they won't be any good.”{PAUSE}“{YELLOW}[Command Materia]{WHITE} lets you use
new commands.”{PAUSE}“There are lots of different kinds of Materia,
so you'll never get bored.
One called [Attack] changes itself.”{PAUSE}“{GREEN}[Magic Materia]{WHITE} is easy.
You can use Magic,
and as your Level increases,
you'll learn new Magic.”{PAUSE}“{RED}[Summon Materia]{WHITE}
let's you use Summon Magic.
As your Level increases,
the number of times you can use
it in a single battle increases.”{PAUSE}“This's one of my favorites.”{PAUSE}“And there you have it,
the five types of Materia.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:29}); // {Cloud}
“There's no single way to combine Materia.
So here goes the basics.”{PAUSE}“Support Materia…
The basic combination is
Magic + All.”{PAUSE}“The variety of magic
you can cast will increase
as your Magic Level increases.”{PAUSE}“When your All level increases,
so does the number of times
you can use it in a battle.
That about covers it.”{PAUSE}“Huh?
Wait a sec…”{PAUSE}“You can change between Magic-All and Magic
with {PURPLE}[PAGEUP/PAGEDOWN]{WHITE}.
I'll bet you've probably already done this.”{PAUSE}“One effective combination is
Elemental + Summon Materia.”{PAUSE}“If you equip this combination to your weapon,
you can put
Magic and Summon Elementals
on your weapon.”{PAUSE}“For example,
if you equip Fire + Elemental to
your sword,
you will end up with
Fire Elemental Sword.”{PAUSE}“I'm getting off the subject,…
If you equip Fire + Elemental to your armor,
it will have twice
the resistance to fire damage.”{PAUSE}“Now this is important.”{PAUSE}“When the Elemental levels
in your armor increase,
so will their effectiveness.
From half damage -

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:30}); // {Cloud}
“Wait, there's more.
Next is the Added Effect
for Support Materia.”{PAUSE}“The Added Effect Materia grafts
the effects of Compound Status
Materia into your weapons and armor.”{PAUSE}“For example, equip
Added Effect + Poison to
your weapon and select [Attack].”{PAUSE}“Sometimes you'll make a Poison attack.
Of course, it doesn't always work.”{PAUSE}“If you don't combine
the Added Effect Materia
with Status Change Materia, like Confusion
or Time, you won't get any effect.”{PAUSE}“To learn more about Added Effect,
access the menu and check the Status.”{PAUSE}“It's a little hard to get,
but if you take your time,
you'll be all right.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:31}); // {Cloud}
“Division…
I'm pretty good at this.”{PAUSE}“People tell me that my personality is divided.
But I don't think so,
but maybe it is?”{PAUSE}“Anyhow…”{PAUSE}“Once your Materia reaches
the maximum level, it will divide.”{PAUSE}“The original Materia will no longer grow.
Once that happens,
all you can do is use it as it is.”{PAUSE}“New Materia always starts out with zero AP,
so you need to raise its levels!”{PAUSE}“Of course, once the new Materia
reaches its max, it'll divide.
That's how you increase
your Materia collection.”{PAUSE}“Ha, ha…
Right now I feel like
I'm dividing myself.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:32}); // {Cloud}
“Once Materia starts dividing,
you must be careful.”{PAUSE}“There's a limit to how much Materia
you can have.”{PAUSE}“Since we're fighting
for the life of the Planet,
it goes against my beliefs
to carry too much Materia.”{PAUSE}“Either way, I don't really care
but, I'll leave it up to you.”{PAUSE}“That's why, the amount of Materia that
we can have is limited to 200…
only what we can equip.”{PAUSE}“When you have too much Materia,
you need to dispose of some.
If you don't, you can't take on
any more.”{PAUSE}“So, ditch some Materia before that happens…
Ahem…I mean,
give them back to the Planet.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:33}); // “OK. Expert!
Enlighten us on Limit Techniques,
why doncha?”

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:35}); // {Cloud}
“There are 2 basic ways of building up
your Limit techniques.
First, just use them!”{PAUSE}“And second is to finish off
as many enemies as possible!
It sounds easier than it is.”{PAUSE}“Everyone knows that when you gain
a new Limit technique,
you need to select it in the menu.”{PAUSE}“And you know that you won't be able to use
advanced techniques on each level
if you haven't used the basic ones.”{PAUSE}“Since the type and growth
for each limit techniques
is different, that's about all I will say.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:36}); // {Cloud}
“A long time ago I heard extreme techniques
exist within the Limit techniques.”{PAUSE}“But, if that's true you wouldn't be able to
get it in any normal way.
That's about all I know about it.”

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:38}); // You cannot take on any more Materia.
Please discard some Materia.

dialogStrings: Respectable Inn

“This is a Respectable Inn…
guests only!”{PAUSE}“You should absorb all the wisdom
until it is a part of you.”

“OK, Mr. Know-it-all, ex-SOLDIER!
Let me revenge…I mean, review!”

{Cloud}
“What do you want to review?”
{CHOICE}ATB
{CHOICE}Onscreen numbers
{CHOICE}Change and Defend
{CHOICE}Escape
{CHOICE}Gauges
{CHOICE}Status
{CHOICE}Elementals
{CHOICE}Help
{CHOICE}That's all

{Cloud}
“I'm not so low as to take money off
a bunch of low-lifes like you.
I'm just doing this to kill time.”

{Cloud}
“ATB means Active Time Battle. It's a
system in which time
continuously runs during battle.”{PAUSE}“If the ATB is changed to
[WAIT] in the Config Menu…
Time stops during battle
while you select magic or an item.”{PAUSE}“That lets you select your commands carefully.
It's geared especially
for beginners like you.”{PAUSE}“In the Config menu, if you change from ATB
to [Recommended]…Time will stop
while magic or item effects are displayed.”{PAUSE}“This lets you watch the effects carefully.
Letting you fight at your own pace…
this is the way to go.”{PAUSE}“I always use ACTIVE mode,
but choose what you want.
That's all.”

{Cloud}
“During a battle,
white numbers that appear on the screen
indicate damage,
and green numbers indicate recovery points.”{PAUSE}“Remember that,
if you don't want to be Wiped Out.”

{Cloud}
“Change will change your fighting position
to either the front or back row.”{PAUSE}“If you select the back row,
the amount of damage
you receive is reduced,
but so is your attacking power.”{PAUSE}“[Change] can be selected from the battle menu
by pushing the [left Directional button].”{PAUSE}“You can also select [Defend] from battle menu
by pushing the Directional button to the right.”{PAUSE}“Defend will reduce your damage by half
until your next turn.”{PAUSE}“It's better to use Defend for strong enemies.
Of course, I don't need anything like that.”

{Cloud}
“I don't know too much about Escape
during battles since I never do it,
but…someone like you might need it.”{PAUSE}“You can escape by holding down
{PURPLE}[PAGEUP]{WHITE} and {PURPLE}[PAGEDOWN]{WHITE} in battle.”

{Cloud}
“It might be hard to understand this next one
since you can't check it right now,
but just listen.”{PAUSE}“I'm talking about the Gauges
displayed during battle.”{PAUSE}“The Time Gauge shows the time remaining
until your next turn during battle.”{PAUSE}“You can enter a command
once the Gauge is full,
but if you don't want to enter a command,
press {PURPLE}[MENU]{WHITE}
to skip to the next person.”{PAUSE}“This is good
when you want to
make {Barret} work.”{PAUSE}“The Limit Gauge increases
as you receive damage.
When this is full,
you are able to use a Limit Technique.”{PAUSE}“The Limit Gauge doesn't reset
after each battle,
so it will build up the more damage
you get in battle.”{PAUSE}“The trick is knowing when to use it
instead of using it as soon as
it becomes available.”{PAUSE}“You may already know this,
but I'll tell you anyways.
Status has two conditions:
Fury and Sadness.”{PAUSE}“Fury speeds up your Limit Gauge,
but decreases your concentration.”{PAUSE}“Sadness slows down your Limit Gauge,
but also decreases the damage you receive.

{Cloud}
“If you don't understand what I just told you,
I guess you just have a limited capacity
for information.”{PAUSE}“But, relax.
Push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE} during battle.”{PAUSE}“A Help Message should explain
the different commands to you.”{PAUSE}“It'll tell you things like the monsters' names.
Even I look at it, sometimes…
so don't be ashamed to use it.”

{Cloud}
“Wiped Out…
I've never really seen it,
but someone told me about it once.”{PAUSE}“When you get Wiped Out, you can
continue from your last Save Point.
Your Experience points will not change.”{PAUSE}“Even wimps like you should be able to
get out of difficult areas
as long as you fight steadily.
You ought to be thankful for this.”

{Cloud}
“Status simply means
the status of the characters.”{PAUSE}“I don't want to repeat myself too much,
so I'll mention the main points.”

Sleep
Cannot enter command until awakened.{PAUSE}Poison
Rapidly decreases HP during battle.{PAUSE}Fury
Doubles damage, reduces concentration.
Tranquilizer cures it.{PAUSE}Sadness
Reduces damage. Hyper cures it.{PAUSE}Petrify
Turns you into stone.
If entire party is petrified,
you'll get Wiped Out.{PAUSE}Confusion
You cannot distinguish
between enemy and ally.{PAUSE}Silence
You cannot cast any Magic.{PAUSE}Paralysis
Time Gauge stops,
you cannot enter commands.{PAUSE}Darkness
Reduces attack concentration.{PAUSE}Frog
Turns you into a frog. I hate this.

{Cloud}
“Phew…I'm tired.”{PAUSE}“Changed Status can be changed
with magic and items, so always double
check it when you buy things.”

{Cloud}
“Elementals are special Materia that
come with magic and weapons.”{PAUSE}“You have to use this
to your advantage in battle.”{PAUSE}“Only once you start thinking
in terms of Elementals can you
truly be called an intermediate player.”{PAUSE}“Here are some examples.
Remember, they're just examples.
You don't have to memorize them.”

Fire
Fire effect. Works best on animals
and water monsters.{PAUSE}Ice
Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters
and things that hate the cold.{PAUSE}Lightning
Lightning effect.
Works best on mechanical things.{PAUSE}Earth
Attacks using the earth's power.
Doesn't work on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Poison
Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on
any poison-based enemies.{PAUSE}Gravity
Gravity-based attack.
These hurt if they hit.{PAUSE}Water
Calls on the earth's water.
Works well on fire monsters.{PAUSE}Wind
Calls up the winds.
Works well on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Holy
Summons the Planet's power.
Works well on dark monsters.

{Cloud}
“Using opposite Elementals often is
effective in battle.”{PAUSE}“Using the same Elementals
usually increases Defense.”{PAUSE}“But, the reverse is also true.
